You can also compare the performance of Bitcoin in different currencies (Euro, Dollar, Sterling) and even measure Bitcoin against Altcoins like Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin, Ripple, IOTA, XLM, EOS & DASH.\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Change & Volatility Monitor:\r\nThe Change & Volatility Monitor describes the direction and magnitude of price fluctuations. If Bitcoin performed positively within the given time span, it is colored in green. Otherwise it is colored in red. Further intervals allow you to examine the price action more closely. The displayed price for an interval is the average price of all exchanges for that moment. Its relative change compared to the price 24 hours ago gives you an understanding of the trend and volatility of the market.\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Cross Coin Check\r\nOur Cross Coin Check gives you a broad insight into market developments and allows you to compare Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Ripple (XRP), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), Litecoin (LTC) and IOTA (MIOTA) among each other. For this purpose, we continuously calculate all the prices and calculate the relation to each other. It is important for us to emphasize that the prices are obtained directly and unaltered by the exchanges! That means, our exchange rates are not manipulated (yes, we're hinting at 'Coinmarketcap').\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Trade Signals\r\nOur purely AI driven trade signals provide you with up-to-date trade recommendations. You can use these recommendations (strong sell, sell, neutral, buy, strong buy) to support your buy, sell or HODL decisions.\r\n\r\nThe current prices for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash, Ripple, Litecoin, XLM, EOS, DASH and IOTA are obtained directly from the exchanges and are not altered like on Coinmarketcap. This means that you get live tickers from exchanges like Kraken, Binance, Coinbase, Coinbase Pro, Poloniex, OKEX, HitBTC, Bitpanda, Bitfinex, Bitstamp and Coinfinity.\r\n\r\nWith our free crypto apps you're well equipped to make the right buying or selling decision of Bitcoin and Altcoins!","descriptionHTML":"Bitcoin Monitor visualizes crypto prices across exchanges, allowing you to spot the cheapest price for the cryptocurrency you&#39;re looking for. Payment partners receive emails for every order placed in their country & can choose to accept the order by copying the order ID from the email and pasting it in the payment partnership screen\r\nTo turn on/off this feature, go to settings and into the \"Payment Partnership\" screen\r\n\r\n> Simple Ledger Token (SLP) Support\r\nZapit also supports SLP tokens. Users can send and receive SLP tokens same as sending and receiving BCH. Device is mounted with a smart card that has obtained the security level required by the financial sector, and Secure OS is built into the microprocessor to provide a secure execution environment to isolate/process private keys and data.\r\nThe fingerprint is enrolled through the fingerprint scanner and it is used to verify the owner at the signing stage of trading cryptocurrency. In addition to fingerprint, the device supports password (PIN) function.\r\nThrough the BLE(Low Power Bluetooth) interface, you can easily transfer cryptocurrency wirelessly in a mobile environment. The cryptocurrency address in QR code shown on the OLED display can be presented to receive money directly to your account.\r\nDownload the latest firmware through the USB cable included in the product package to keep your D‚ÄôCENT Biometric Hardware Wallet up to date. \r\n\r\n[Main Features]\r\n1.\tEmbedded with Secure OS developed by TEE(Trusted Execution Environment) technology experts.\r\n2.\tUse in a mobile environment through BLE(Low Power Bluetooth).\r\n3.\tDisplay the cryptocurrency address as a QR code on the OLED screen.\r\n4.\tWith battery capacity of 585mA, it lasts for one month on a single full charge.\r\n5.\tUse the USB cable included in the product package to download the latest firmware and keep the device up to date.\r\n\r\n‚ñ† D‚ÄôCENT Card-type Hardware Wallet\r\nD‚ÄôCENT Card-type Hardware Wallet allows you to manage cryptocurrency assets with a simple touch. The cryptocurrency itself is not in the wallet. In case of bitcoin and cryptocurrencies derived from it, the cryptocurrency is decentrally stored and maintained in a publicly available ledger called the blockchain.\r\n\r\nFunctionality\r\n\r\nA multicryptocurrency wallet, comparable to a bank account, contains a pair of public and private cryptographic keys. A public key allows for other wallets to make payments to the wallet's address, whereas a private key enables the spending of cryptocurrency from that address.\r\n\r\nWallet types\r\n\r\nWallets can either be digital apps or be hardware based. They either store the private key with the user, or the private key is stored remotely and transactions are authorized by a third party.\r\n\r\nDeterministic wallet\r\n\r\nWith a deterministic wallet a single key can be used to generate an entire tree of key pairs. This single key serves as the root of the tree. The generated mnemonic sentence or word seed is simply a more human-readable way of expressing the key used as the root, as it can be algorithmically converted into the root private key. Those words, in that order, will always generate exactly the same root key. A word phrase could consist of 24 words like: begin friend black earth beauty praise pride refuse horror believe relief gospel end destroy champion build better awesome. That single root key is not replacing all other private keys, but rather is being used to generate them. All the addresses still have different private keys, but they can all be restored by that single root key. The private keys to every address it has and will ever give out can be recalculated given the root key. That root key, in turn, can be recalculated by feeding in the word seed. The mnemonic sentence is the backup of the wallet. If a wallet supports the same (mnemonic sentence) technique, then the backup can also be restored on another software or hardware wallet.\r\n\r\nA mnemonic sentence is considered secure. The BIP-39 standard creates a 512 bit seed from any given mnemonic. The set of possible wallets is 2. Every passphrase leads to a valid wallet. If the wallet was not previously used it will be empty.\r\n\r\nNon-deterministic wallet\r\n\r\nIn a non-deterministic wallet, each key is randomly generated on its own accord, and they are not seeded from a common key. Therefore, any backups of the wallet must store each and every single private key used as an address, as well as a buffer of 100 or so future keys that may have already been given out as addresses but not received payments yet.","descriptionHTML":"Supported cryptocurrencies: BTC ‚Äì Bitcoin, BCH ‚Äì Bitcoin Cash, BNT ‚Äì Bancor, CVC ‚Äì Civic, DGD ‚Äì DigixDAO, DSH ‚Äì Dash, EDG ‚Äì Edgeless, EOS ‚Äì Dawn, ETC ‚Äì Ethereum Classic, ETH ‚Äì Ethereum, GNO ‚Äì Gnosis, GNT ‚Äì Golem, LTC ‚Äì Litecoin, PLY ‚Äì Polymath, QTUM ‚Äì Quantum, SNM ‚Äì SONM, STX ‚Äì Stox, SWM ‚Äì Swarm, VIB ‚Äì Viberate, ZEC ‚Äì Zcash, BAT ‚Äì Basic Attention Token.<br><br>Cryptowallet<br><br>A multicryptocurrency wallet is a device, physical medium, program or a service which stores the public and/or private keys and can be used to track ownership, receive or spend cryptocurrencies. The cryptocurrency itself is not in the wallet. In case of bitcoin and cryptocurrencies derived from it, the cryptocurrency is decentrally stored and maintained in a publicly available ledger called the blockchain.<br><br>Functionality<br><br>A multicryptocurrency wallet, comparable to a bank account, contains a pair of public and private cryptographic keys. A public key allows for other wallets to make payments to the wallet&#39;s address, whereas a private key enables the spending of cryptocurrency from that address.<br><br>Wallet types<br><br>Wallets can either be digital apps or be hardware based. They either store the private key with the user, or the private key is stored remotely and transactions are authorized by a third party.<br><br>Deterministic wallet<br><br>With a deterministic wallet a single key can be used to generate an entire tree of key pairs. This single key serves as the root of the tree. The generated mnemonic sentence or word seed is simply a more human-readable way of expressing the key used as the root, as it can be algorithmically converted into the root private key. Those words, in that order, will always generate exactly the same root key. A word phrase could consist of 24 words like: begin friend black earth beauty praise pride refuse horror believe relief gospel end destroy champion build better awesome. That single root key is not replacing all other private keys, but rather is being used to generate them. All the addresses still have different private keys, but they can all be restored by that single root key. The private keys to every address it has and will ever give out can be recalculated given the root key. That root key, in turn, can be recalculated by feeding in the word seed. The mnemonic sentence is the backup of the wallet. If a wallet supports the same (mnemonic sentence) technique, then the backup can also be restored on another software or hardware wallet.<br><br>A mnemonic sentence is considered secure. The BIP-39 standard creates a 512 bit seed from any given mnemonic. The set of possible wallets is 2. Every passphrase leads to a valid wallet. If the wallet was not previously used it will be empty.<br><br>Non-deterministic wallet<br><br>In a non-deterministic wallet, each key is randomly generated on its own accord, and they are not seeded from a common key. Therefore, any backups of the wallet must store each and every single private key used as an address, as well as a buffer of 100 or so future keys that may have already been given out as addresses but not received payments yet.","summary":"Easily send, receive and even exchange 20 cryptocurrencies right in your wallet.","installs":"1,000+","minInstalls":1000,"maxInstalls":1658,"score":4.428571,"scoreText":"4.4","ratings":42,"reviews":20,"histogram":{"1":6,"2":0,"3":0,"4":0,"5":36},"price":0,"free":true,"currency":"USD","priceText":"Free","offersIAP":false,"size":"3.3M","androidVersion":"2.1","androidVersionText":"2.1 and up","developer":"FinSec","developerId":"FinSec","developerEmail":"crypto_wallet_supp247@gmail.com","developerInternalID":"5740974679173119746","genre":"Finance","genreId":"FINANCE","icon":"https://play-lh.googleusercontent.com/SLi5647sxbNUNyk3Ds25ivbmxDQpmqDVvrDjW4bDKuM8PaBQZz4osR-MvN-_4jR-MjA","headerImage":"https://play-lh.googleusercontent.com/16EUgRXRS8CrweBIZRLnubqukTpgAPCCpQsVBWr7W5WxMXLA_4Kl91AyD_2vKXffvxo","screenshots":["https://play-lh.googleusercontent.com/Bc75QbX1xSOXOdxRUPGICOK-2av6P3282Tz25XWWm6OshszwojC8lMT69jQafaThEoA","https://play-lh.googleusercontent.com/FVRlssu3n6IxVDrggw3B7Mmmx5HuSPc8xpGSoKOaONeACz1IIQGEF7oCA2m4wruECAcM"],"contentRating":"Everyone","adSupported":false,"released":"Feb 1, 2020","updated":1614099927000,"version":"3.0","comments":["Tried to deposit some coins and so far nothing has come through even though it's already confirmed on the blockchain...
